parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To be raving mad, speak as a madman. Middle voice from a primary mao; to rave as a 'maniac'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To assert emphatically, lean upon. From dia and a derivative of ischuros; to stout it through, i.e. Asservate.
To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.
